    • v5.9.1 - June 2022

    • v5.7 - December 2021

v5.11.1 - Dec 2022

Features

  • Add support for AdHawk Hub for Android v3.0 release

Bug Fixes

  • Per-eye gaze is recorded even when the preview is disabled

v5.11 - October 2022

Features

  • Improved robustness and precision of eye tracking signals by reducing pupil noise
  • Support for tagging, filtering, and sorting session recordings
  • Support for playback and export of session recordings that have audio
  • Usability improvements when exporting recorded data from AdHawk Hub
  • Provide measured eye offsets on Track page to help with optimal glasses fitting
  • Extend keyboard shortcuts in AdHawk Hub to include Quick Start
  • Sign AdHawk’s app bundles and dmg on Mac OS X
  • Support for AdHawk MindLink 2.5mm
  • General usability improvements in AdHawk Hub

Bug Fixes

  • Front-facing camera working properly on Mac OS version of AdHawk Hub

Caveats

  • Component offset API introduces large error in eye tracking output

v5.9.1 - June 2022

Features

  • Improved robustness and precision of eye tracking signals by reducing glint noise
  • Support for tagging and filtering session recordings

Caveats

  • Front-facing camera does not work on Mac OS version of AdHawk Hub

v5.9 - May 2022

Features

  • Improved robustness and precision of eye tracking signals by reducing glint noise
  • Improved population coverage through automatic emitter adjustments
  • Improved playback of session recordings that have gaps in eye tracking data
  • Longer Android recordings that created multiple video files can now be played back seamlessly in AdHawk Hub

Bug Fixes

  • ‘Grid’ mode (used for calibration and validation) is now called ‘fixed head’
  • ‘VOR’ mode (used for calibration and validation) is now called ‘fixed gaze’
  • Fixed device calibration process getting stuck before completing
  • Fixed accuracy of 5 point calibration (introduced in version 5.8)

Caveats

  • Front-facing camera does not work on Mac OS version of AdHawk Hub

v5.8 - March 2022

Features

  • Add support for managing the front-facing camera and performing all image processing in the AdHawk Backend Service
  • Add the ability to log IMU data from glasses in AdHawk Hub
  • Add ability to launch the Nosepiece wizard separately from profile creation
  • Change the gaze marker size to be the radius of the marker rather than the diameter
  • Allow customization of aruco marker sizes in the AdHawk Hub to accomodate larger displays
  • Detect AdHawk Hub application crashes and create a crash report on the next launch

API Updates

With the introduction of front-facing camera support in AdHawk Backend Service, the following features are now available in the Python SDK: * Built-in Quickstart, Calibration, and Validation GUIs provided by AdHawk Backend Service to walk users through the respective procedure * Ability to stream the video from the front-facing camera captured by the AdHawk Backend Service to frontend clients * Ability to get the projection of the gaze ray inside the image captured by the front-facing camera * GAZE_IN_IMAGE stream (0x07): x and y gaze coordinates inside the camera frame * Screen Tracking: The ability to map the user’s gaze onto a computer screen in real time * GAZE_IN_SCREEN stream (0x08): x and y gaze coordinates inside the computer screen

See the API documentation for more details

Bug Fixes

  • Refresh Adhawk Hub replay list after downloading Android recordings
  • Improved robustness when loading recordings in AdHawk Hub Replay
  • Download Blink and IMU data from Android recordings in the AdHawk Hub
  • Fix maximum zoom out in AdHawk Hub plots
  • Fix IMU Rotation stream (0x19) to send bias corrected data
  • Gracefully handle device disconnect during firmware update and device calibration
  • Ensure installing the AdHawk Eye Tracking Windows MSI removes the previously installed version

v5.7.2 - February 2022

Bug Fixes

  • Fix software update issue introduced in v5.7.1

v5.7.1 - January 2022

Bug Fixes

  • Improve robustness of the device calibration
  • Fix missing data files when downloading Android recordings
  • Fix AdHawk Hub crashes when replaying Android recordings

v5.7 - December 2021

Features

  • Guided workflow to simplify setting up and using the AdHawk MindLink glasses
  • Automatic detection and notification of available software and firmware upgrades
  • Automatic detection and notification when the glasses require re-calibration
  • Automatic detection of AdHawks front-facing camera on Windows platforms
    • Ensure the camera index in the AdHawk HUB is always set to 0 on Windows platforms
  • ‘About’ page added to the AdHawk Backend Service. It is accessible from the context menu
  • Additional connectivity information provided in the AdHawk Backend Service context menu
  • New release notes screen (See Help > Release Notes)
  • Windows executables are now signed
  • Unix timestamps (UTC) are added to CSV recordings from the AdHawk Hub

API Updates

  • Blink detection framework and relevant APIs are now available
  • Improved API documentation on the “tracker ready” stream
  • Fixes in autotune position property APIs

Bug Fixes

  • Replay performance and robustness improvements
  • Firmware update stability improvements
  • Significant performance improvements in the AdHawk Backend service
